result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Status hearing on April 25, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

11:53 AM Defendant Joshua D Radewan appeared by video means. Prosecuting Atty Brian J. Juech appeared for State of Wisconsin.
Atty Juech states he does not believe there is an agreement.  Defendant states he gave a counter offer.  Atty Juech requests matter be put on trial calendar.  Defendant would like to contact the PD's office at this time.
BY THE COURT:  Set for further status.  Status hearing scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Status hearing on March 21, 2022 at 11:30 am.
*Appear for booking within 30 days to the Marquette County Jail  *No violent or abusive contact with Victim 1    **Bond to be signed and returned to the COC office within 14 days

11:03 AM Defendant Joshua D Radewan appeared by video means. Prosecuting Atty Clifford C. Burdon appeared for State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands.    Court confirms address and phone.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands and did call the Public Defender office but he is not eligible.    Defendant waives their right to an attorney so he can speak with the DA.    Court finds waiver of attorney made freely, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
  Court finds probable cause for the charge for Riverside purposes.

  Atty Burdon has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.
Defendant asks that the no contact be part of the bond; a letter was sent to the DA regarding this contact.  Atty Burdon does not know if a letter was received yet or not.  

  BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*Appear for booking within 30 days to the Marquette County Jail
*No violent or abusive contact with Victim 1
  **Bond to be signed and returned to the COC office within 14 days  Status hearing scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 11:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Joshua D Radewan

Prior: 510 Underwood Ave #7, Montello, WI 53949
